reasoning: Ring chromosome 12 is ultra-rare chromosomal abnormality with fewer than 10 cases reported in medical literature. Ring chromosomes overall occur at ~1 per 50,000 births; chromosome 12 ring comprises 0.7% of ring chromosome cases, estimated at <0.01 per 100,000 births.
source: Orphanet; GARD (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center)
